alert.note: Alert for Eastern Clinton; Southern Franklin; Western Clinton; Western Essex (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 01 at 7:32PM EDT by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Clinton, southern Franklin and northwestern Essex Counties through 830 PM EDT... At 731 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Adirondack Regional Airport, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Torrential rainfall and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Localized flooding and minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Adirondack Regional Airport, Saranac Lake, Lake Placid, Schuyler Falls, Saranac, Wawbeek, Dannemora, Lyon Mountain, Peasleeville, Clayburg, Harrietstown, Paul Smiths, Chazy Lake, Union Falls, Saranac Inn, Ray Brook, Morrisonville, Moffittsville, Cadyville, and Gabriels. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Clinton; Southern Franklin; Western Clinton; Western Essex
